org.hibernate.query.sqm.tree.from

Interface UsageDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutableUsageDetails
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UsageDetailsImpl

    public interface UsageDetails
    Details about how a SqmFrom is used in the query.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      EnumSet<DowncastLocation> getDowncastLocations()
      The locations where downcasts happened
      Collection<ManagedTypeDescriptor> getIncidentalSubclassIndicators()
      An incidental subclass indicator is given when the SqmFrom is downcast when referenced outside the from-clause.
      ManagedTypeDescriptor getIntrinsicSubclassIndicator()
      An intrinsic subclass indicator is given when the SqmFrom is defined in the from-clause.
      Collection<Navigable> getReferencedNavigables()
      All of the "sub" navigables referenced from the described SqmFrom.
      boolean isUsedInFrom()
      Is it used in the from-clause? todo (6.0) : use this from visiting from-clause
      boolean isUsedInSelect()
      Is it used in the select-clause?
      boolean isUsedInWhere()
      todo (6.0) : are uses in join predicates important? If so, should this be `#isUsedInPredicate`? Or would a separate `#isUsedInJoinPredicate` be more appropriate?

    • Method Detail

      • isUsedInFrom

        boolean isUsedInFrom()
        Is it used in the from-clause? todo (6.0) : use this from visiting from-clause

      • isUsedInSelect

        Is it used in the select-clause?

      • isUsedInWhere

        boolean isUsedInWhere()
        todo (6.0) : are uses in join predicates important? If so, should this be `#isUsedInPredicate`? Or would a separate `#isUsedInJoinPredicate` be more appropriate?

      • getIntrinsicSubclassIndicator

        ManagedTypeDescriptor getIntrinsicSubclassIndicator()
        An intrinsic subclass indicator is given when the SqmFrom is defined in the from-clause. E.g.: select c from Order o join treat( o.customer as ApacCustomer ) c here, the intrinsic subclass indicator for the `o.customer` join would be the `ApacCustomer` subclass of `Customer`

      • getIncidentalSubclassIndicators

        Collection<ManagedTypeDescriptor> getIncidentalSubclassIndicators()
        An incidental subclass indicator is given when the SqmFrom is downcast when referenced outside the from-clause. E.g. select treat( o.customer as ApacCustomer ).someApacSpecificDetail from Order o todo (6.0) : another way to look at this is that this particular example also illustrates an intrinsic subclass indicator Maybe the keeping the combo of downcast-target and location is needed afterall. that or allow intrinsic indicators to be multi-valued

      • getDowncastLocations

        EnumSet<DowncastLocation> getDowncastLocations()
        The locations where downcasts happened

      • getReferencedNavigables

        Collection<Navigable> getReferencedNavigables()
        All of the "sub" navigables referenced from the described SqmFrom. E.g., given the `SqmRoot(Person p)` I'd get for `"... from Person p..."`, and given the selection `"select p.id, p.name, p.age from Person p..."` - that SqmRoot would contain `EntityIdentifier(id), SingularAttribute(name), SingularAttribute(age)` as its `referencedNavigables`.
